comments.commentBody: Kellyanne Conway needs to send her soul to the dry cleaners.

if more recordings were to emerge, he would respond with more personal attacks on Mrs. Clinton and her husband.

A threat, right? Big deal, he's going to make more personal attacks anyway. It's all he knows how to do.

The GOP has been fracturing for a decade or longer, right back to the Bush years when they broke their promises to the evangelicals. The Tea Party arose out of this frustration and Trump came out of their anger. The bottom line is that there is a vast gulf between the urban educated Republican and the uneducated ("I love the uneducated" Trump) white middle and lower middle classes.

Only by using code words - the most obvious recent one being "Hillary" - to paper over the fracture, has the GOP been able to prevent a split from occuring. Trump accelerated the split because he uses language that incite the redneck GOP but repel the more educated ones.

Clearly, the GOP hoped to get through this presidential cycle with a Bush or Rubio but Trump trumped them all. The party probably should separate into two distinct conservative parties. These two can then work together, along with the Democrats on some issues to get Congress moving. Moderate GOPers should jettison the tea party people.

What people say in private is their own business. Especially if they are not running for office and holding themselves up as some kind of moral beacon. Trump's (repeated) misogynistic, predatory comments are made in public, and have been over a period of decades. He's a repeat offender.

I'm wondering why you'd have trouble with a young woman saying she was sexually assaulted. Your candidate trotted out Bill Clinton's accusers and cynically used them as a photo op. Why is that okay, and why are their accusations given more credence than those of a woman (not a "young lady") who accuses a man of assault? Or does that standard exist for everyone else except the admitted predator Trump?

Hillary isn't stupid enough to talk girl talk into a mic she pinned on herself with someone else in control of the recording, a member of the Bush family, no less. While ladies can get crude, I've never heard any female brag about sexually assaulting a male. We joke about their small flagpoles. Everyone can see if we've got a rack, and we're not worried about such silliness.

The classic joke: What are two things you should never do in bed? Point and laugh.

I'm laughing at Trump.

Having once been a college male, I can assure you that I never spoke of any woman (or man) in such a cruel, disrespectful and obscene manner, nor would I have associated with any person who did.

The real problem is that you (or any other person) COULD feel that this kind of behavior is normal and/or acceptable.

As for the other stuff -- Bill Clinton may have been guilty of this kind of behavior in the past. Although I never heard him claim that it was OK or appropriate. If it had come to light in 1992 it might have cost him the Presidency. But he isn't running for anything. So how in the world does that excuse similar, well-documented behavior by Mr. Trump, a man who publicly takes pride in treating woman as objects and shows not one iota of remorse for his actions.

Please explain?

Hypocrisy? So you tell me HRC in summer camps and high school, and college never engaged with other girls in speaking of men in demeaning terms?

Even today in NYC, in 'private conversations' I am sure that Modern Progressive Liberal Women use some unsavory words regarding men and how much in material benefits they are able to extract.

If you have a college age son you should be worried that now young ladies can declare rape accusations weeks later. 20 years ago in the news we heard stories that certain women had to keep their mouths shut after relations with a certain governor, or face the wrath of the Arkansas State police. It befuddles ghe mind the hypocrisy.
Paul Ryan endorsed the fire and has not withdrawn his endorsement of the fire. Paul Ryan is not a good man.

If ever there was a conspiracy theory that the Dems or the GOP'rs were being controlled by a vast and powerful this or that..The Donald dispels that myth.  Unless one believes that somehow all of the decision makers and king makers of the 'Pubs were all simultaneously given lobotomies and castrations, you couldn't make this stuff up. This is further evidence that wealth, power, influence buying and pirate capitalism and being Light, White and Right; certainly doesn't make anyone smarter, wiser or more morale. Their God must have a sense of humor.  Didn't Big J say," Pride goeth before the Fall."  "The Meek shall inherit the Earth" and "It is easier for a camel to pass thru the eye of a needle than for a wealthy man to pass into heaven." "Like a man spitting at the world while lying on his back..."  stated by Ikjin Chai, a Tae Kwon Do teacher with a small following of devoted students; no political power and only the wealth of the love of family and friends. The Donald should get to the Dojo for some learning.

Paul Ryan has become the Neville Chamberlain of the Republican Party, hoping that by appeasing Donald Trump he could avoid a takeover of the GOP by fanatics who do not believe in the rule of law.  Like everyone else who has cut a deal with Trump, however, Ryan has gotten burned.  Being an effective speaker requires a backbone.  Ryan does not appear to have one.
How old are you? I'm curious

I don't believe anyone could have ever anticipated that Trump would get this far.

It's been a perfect storm of anger, ignorance, and media coverage that no one could have imagined--it seems extremely unlikely that it would have been considered a credible scheme, by anyone.
Right on!  Thank you

Remember the wing nuts who took over federal land in Oregon? The same jerks who had rifles aimed at federal officials because country welfare queen Cliven Bundy didn't want to pay grazing fees to use land that is owned by all of us? Yes, those guys, the same "deplorables" HRC mentioned awhile ago. These people need to have Trump lose the election by at least twenty million votes. Oh, they will still point to a "rigged" election. But maybe a giant margin will show them that they do not speak for the majority of Americans, silent or not. They need to lose, and lose badly. They are no more patriotic than the man in the moon. Let us show them who really loves this country. Get out and vote for Hillary Clinton.
But not gridlock.
If Hillary Clinton wins the presidential election, she will, unwittingly, go down in history as the woman who saved this country from the imminent grip of dictatorship.

The chickens have come home to roost.
Now they have to figure out where to land.

The fact that Mr Ryan still endorses a candidate who has boasted of grabbing women in their private parts and other manifestations of being a predator makes it very clear that he is dishonest with the American public and a total hypocrite.

The first time someone told me to "Go back to China", I was ten and hardly cared. I was as Americanized as any other kid in the Bay Area suburbs; didn't speak Chinese, was tired of the food, and was born five minutes outside San Francisco. The insult didn't even appear to make sense to me. But the older I get, and the more our deeply hateful rhetoric becomes normalized, the sadder I grow at the prospect that even twenty years ago, the people I grew up with were learning that I, and people who look like me, didn't belong in here. i am distressed by this article, more than surprised.

How have you played the race game to your advantage? To me it seems Asians work twice as hard as Caucasians in average to get to the same level of economic or social success. Look at the level of Asian academic achievements and their representation in Ivy League and top tier schools is still not reflective of that.
Among the many people expressing support for you, George Takei should be counted. Live long and prosper.

Wow...you conveniently ignore the fact that immigration did not begin in the 1960's, that this country was/is/will always be a melting pot and that anyone, white or otherwise, who feel it is "their" country in the sense that it might not be anyone else's who does not look like them does not deserve ANY sympathy...their ignorance of history, or as is the case in your remark, their re-shaping history, does not allow for passivity or defense. It requires all of us to teach ourselves and our neighbors better...it requires that we all remember who we are, how we came to be so comfortable with celebrating Christopher Columbus when he was, in fact, the seed that planted genocide and lies for what became this forest of warped citizenry. Wake up...your limited view of truth is part of what lies at the heart of our racial turbulence...I think you meant well but we are too far gone to allow that to be enough. Go back to your statement "perhaps rightly" and re-think just how "rightly" we are to think this is not everyone's country!
Tony, just like the lady in NYC you're a narrow minded buffoon.  Obviously you have an axe to grind with whitey. Enjoy your evening.

As an Asian American, I am sadden by Michael's story. As a citizen of this great country, it reminds me why we must defeat Trump whose position as a presidential candidate legitimizes the basest instincts of some people. By soundly defeating Trump, we show the world, and most importantly show ourselves, that racism, misogyny and religious profiling are not tolerated by the majority in the United States of America. By joining force to defeat Trump as citizens regardless of our race, religion, sexual orientation, or even political affiliation, we show ourselves that the path to a better world is being together. By defeating Trump, we will know that a better world is possible. Because knowing a better world is possible, it will be.
I actually had been yelled to go back to Russia many times.
I hope you realize that you're as bigoted as the white woman described in this article. Generalizing about "whites" is as bigoted.
I was curious about that observation, too. Was it to distinguish the woman's class background? Or to note his own expectations of behavior among those displaying certain degree of prosperity?

I didn't need anything to help the medicine go down. I loved the Bircher muesli then, and still do.

I think most of the WPers did all right R/Elke. My street is lined with centarian pin oaks that tend to come down in this kind of storm, usually falling across the street. One did so in the park a half-block from my house, taking out the power lines. Excavations and repairs took 3 days, but I had refuge at my daughter's place. River cresting is not expected to peak till Friday, however, so some of the worst flooding is yet to come, with dams being breached and entire townships being evacuated.

The nice part is that the Grandboy has been home since colleges in Charleston closed down.

Elke--Durham had a Saturday full of rain and gusty winds; some areas had flooding problems but they didn't affect the city generally. Scattered power outages ranging from flickering to 36 hours (among my friends). Farther east and southeast it's a different story. Major flooding in a lot of the eastern part of the state. Sections of I-95 and I-40 are closed b/c of flooding. Rivers are rising for the next couple of days and people are worried about dams breaking.

We own a condo at Hilton Head--they're just now (3pm Tuesday) lifting restrictions and letting people come back onto the island. Huge numbers of trees down, especially off the main roads. We're waiting to find out what happened in our neighborhood; the property managers haven't been able to get in and assess the situation. Some power is back on, some water & sewer is working, but not all. It's a mess.

and Elke

Leapy and Liz- thanks for the NC status report. Am sorry and wish you lots of strength to deal with it all.
Leapy- sloppy writing on my part- muesli (which I also still make/eat )helped the daily dose of cod liver oil go down :)) :((

and Elke
Only initial ERROR was mixing up PERU and OHIO.
Did spend a couple of minutes talking out loud , trying to get the -CH. Never heard of "He'SO FINE. Tried to visualize knights in CHAIN mail UNDERWEAR....
Had gaZILLION briefly, which I think is an even more ginormous number.

More than the answer DICE , I prefer Einstein's quote:" Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe ". Still relevant.
Nice to see ROO . This month it's 90 years since the book "Winnie The Pooh " was published. Winnie is named after Winnipeg (Manitoba):
en. Wikipedia.org/wiki/Winnie-The-Pooh

MUSLIN reminds me of MU(e)SLI(N), which reminds me of SWISS.
So , to all the SWISS puzzlers who may be LURKing ( OK- not you, Barry A.) : Gruezi mitenand and Ciao.
ALOHA

Michael did good.

I am glad he actually went to confront her.

Racist bullies, no matter gender or race, thrive because no one challenges them. They need fear put back into them.

No doubt this woman thought, "those weak Asians won't do anything." So good on you Michael. Maybe she'll think next time before opening her stupid mouth.

You fight fire with fire.
No one should hate the country that they live in. I hope your wife will soon see the light and agree to return to India with you. You will both be much happier.
